original_solution_mapping.L1: Out of every 5 berries, she eats 1, so only 5 strawberries - 1 strawberry = <<5-1=4>>4 strawberries go into the basket for each handful.
original_solution_mapping.L2: The basket holds 60 strawberries, so it will take 60 strawberries / 4 strawberries per handful = <<60/4=15>>15 handfuls to fill the basket.
original_solution_mapping.L3: So in total, Susan will pick 60 strawberries + 15 handfuls * 1 strawberry eaten per handful = <<60+15*1=75>>75 strawberries.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3084.
    Returns: the total number of berries Susan will pick.
    """
    # L1
    total_berries_per_handful = 5 # every handful of 5 strawberries
    eaten_berries_per_handful = 1 # eat one of them herself
    berries_in_basket_per_handful = total_berries_per_handful - eaten_berries_per_handful

    # L2
    basket_capacity = 60 # basket holds 60 strawberries
    handfuls_to_fill_basket = basket_capacity / berries_in_basket_per_handful

    # L3
    total_berries_picked = basket_capacity + handfuls_to_fill_basket * eaten_berries_per_handful

    # FA
    answer = total_berries_picked
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Out of every {total_berries_per_handful} berries, she eats {eaten_berries_per_handful}, so only {total_berries_per_handful} strawberries - {eaten_berries_per_handful} strawberry = <<{total_berries_per_handful}-{eaten_berries_per_handful}={berries_in_basket_per_handful}>>{berries_in_basket_per_handful} strawberries go into the basket for each handful.

The basket holds {basket_capacity} strawberries, so it will take {basket_capacity} strawberries / {berries_in_basket_per_handful} strawberries per handful = <<{basket_capacity}/{berries_in_basket_per_handful}={handfuls_to_fill_basket}>>{handfuls_to_fill_basket} handfuls to fill the basket.

So in total, Susan will pick {basket_capacity} strawberries + {handfuls_to_fill_basket} handfuls * {eaten_berries_per_handful} strawberry eaten per handful = <<{basket_capacity}+{handfuls_to_fill_basket}*{eaten_berries_per_handful}={total_berries_picked}>>{total_berries_picked} strawberries.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Out of every 5 berries, she eats 1, so only 5 strawberries - 1 strawberry = <<5-1=4>>4 strawberries go into the basket for each handful.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The basket holds 60 strawberries, so it will take 60 strawberries / 4 strawberries per handful = <<60/4=15>>15 handfuls to fill the basket.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So in total, Susan will pick 15 strawberries + 15 handfuls * 1 strawberry eaten per handful = <<15+15*1=30>>30 strawberries.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'handfuls_to_fill_basket' (15.0) was used instead of 'basket_capacity' (60).
